intro: Sisymbrium laciniosum, commonly known as the fringed poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. Its leaves are often lobed and have a slightly hairy texture. Sisymbrium laciniosum is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
